Ron Pat-El, PhD.

About Me

Welcome to my webpage. Over the past years I have researched student motivation and how learning environments can be designed to foster it.

I love to evaluate the tools researchers use to answer their research questions. As such my work has focused on validation procedures for questionnaires as well as delving into novel ways of testing psychological theories of dynamic group processes. Check out this page to know more about my research and research experience and my education background.

Selected Publications

  • Verboon, P., & Pat-El, R. J. (2022). Clustering longitudinal data using R: A Monte Carlo study. Methodology: European Journal of Research Methods for the Behavioral and Social Sciences, 18(2), 144–163. https://doi.org/10.5964/meth.7143
  • Strijbos, J.-W., Pat-El, R. J., & Narciss, S. (2021). Structural validity and invariance of the Feedback Perceptions Questionnaire. Studies in Educational Evaluation, 68, 1–12. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.stueduc.2021.100980
  • Pat-El, R. J., Tillema, H., Segers, M., & Vedder, P. (2013). Validation of Assessment for Learning Questionnaires for teachers and students. The British Journal of Educational Psychology, 83(1), 98–113. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.2044-8279.2011.02057.x
  • Pat-El, R. J., Tillema, H., & van Koppen, S. W. M. (2012). Effects of formative feedback on intrinsic motivation: Examining ethnic differences. Learning and Individual Differences, 22(4), 449–454. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.lindif.2012.04.001
